label.en: 24/25 S regular part 3 3 CP SV Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 3. osa 3 EAP SV Eng

description.en: The aim of the course is to familiarize students with microeconometrics suitable for individual level data on the economic behavior of individuals or firms using regression methods for cross section and panel data. The course starts with an introduction of maximum likelihood method and generalized method of moments. Then modelling of various qualitative and limited (censored and truncated) dependent variables is discussed. The following models are covered: binary logit and probit, multinomial logit and probit, ordered probit and logit, tobit mudel, Heckman selection models, Poisson and Negbin count data models, Cox and parametric duration models. Panel data methods are discussed: within-group estimator, between-group estimator, random effects estimator, Arellano-Bond estimator. Theoretical aspects are discussed during the lectures and empirical examples are studied in computer classes using econometric program R. (Stata codes are also provided.)
description.et:
1.      Ülevaade hindamismeetoditest: vähimruutude meetod, suurima tõepära meetod, üldistatud momentide meetod, hüpoteeside testimine, simuleerimisel baseeruvad meetodid
2.      Binaarse tunnuse mudelid (probit, logit)
3.      Multinoomse väärtusega tunnuse mudelid (multinomial logit/probit, järjestatud logit/probit)
4.      Tobit mudel ja selektsioonimudelid
5.      Kestusanalüüs
6.      Loenduvate andmete mudelid
7.      Lineaarsed paneelandmete mudelid,
8.      Dünaamilised paneelandmete mudelid
9.      Mittelineaarsed paneelandmete mudelid

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to familiarize students with microeconometric methods suitable for the analysis of micro data (cross section data and panel data) of individuals, households, and firms.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada tudengitele mikroökonomeetrilisi meetodeid, mis on sobilikud isikute, majapidamiste ja firmade mikroandmete (ristandmed ja paneelandmed) analüüsimiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: ·	microeconometric methods and their suitability to analyse the behaviour of economic subjects
learning_outcomes.et: - mikroökonomeetrilisi meetodeid ja nende sobivust majandussubjektide käitumise analüüsimiseks,

learning_outcomes.en: ·	how to analyse different types of micro data (cross-section data, panel data, continuous data, discrete data, censored data)
learning_outcomes.et: - kuidas analüüsida erinevat tüüpi andmeid (ristandmed, paneelandmed, pidevad tunnused, diskreetsed tunnused, tsenseeritud tunnused),

learning_outcomes.en: ·	how to build, evaluate, interpret and present the results of econometric models
learning_outcomes.et: - kuidas püstitada, hinnata, tõlgendada ja esitada ökonomeetrilise analüüsi tulemusi,

learning_outcomes.en: ·	how to implement these methods in R. (Stata do-files are also provided.)
learning_outcomes.et: - kuidas rakendada meetodeid R-is. (Lisatakse ka Stata näitekoodid).

independent_work.et: Home assignments based on exercises given in computer tutorials.

description.et: Homework on static and dynamic panel data - deadline 19.05

grade_evaluation.et: Five tests based on homeworks (a 20%). Optionally one test can be replaced by a Datacamp course

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
Cameron, A. Colin, Trivedi, Pravin K. (2005) Microeconometrics: Methods and Applications, Cambridge University Press
Woodridge, Jeffrey M. (2010). Econometric Analysis of Cross Section and Panel Data , Cambridge, Massachusetts: MIT Press.
